alert.note: Alert for Lower Yukon Valley; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 4:27PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by backwater from recent ice jams and snowmelt. * WHERE...Lower Yukon and associated tributaries from Graying downstream to the Yukon Delta as far as Nunam Iqua and Kotlik. * WHEN...Until 400 PM AKDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Backwater from ice jams between Russian Mission and the Yukon Delta as well as snowmelt has lead to extensive overbank flooding of lowlands on the Lower Yukon from Grayling through the Delta, as well as the Innoko River at Shageluk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 414 PM AKDT, - The breakup front has already passed the delta, however water levels remain high from snowmelt and the recent ice jams. The USGS river gage at Pilot Station shows that the water has only dropped about a half foot since its crest on Friday. Satellite imagery confirms overland flooding in Shageluk, Holy Cross, Russian Mission, Marshall and Pilot Station. Water levels will likely be increasing for the the communities of Emmonak, Alakanuk, Nunam Iqua and Kotlik, but are unlikely to reach the levels experienced over the weekend. Water levels from Graying through the delta will remain high over the coming days. - For Yukon River at Pilot Station: At 3:45pm the stage was 29.28 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information.
